alert.note: Alert for Adair; Choctaw; Creek; Delaware; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 07 at 2:36AM CDT until July 08 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT TODAY... ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heat index values 105 to 108 expected. * WHERE...In Oklahoma, Adair, Creek, Delaware, Pawnee, Ottawa, Pushmataha, Choctaw and Osage Counties. In Arkansas, Washington AR and Benton Counties. * WHEN...From 1 PM to 8 PM CDT Today and Friday. * IMPACTS...The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a dangerous situation in which heat illnesses are possible.
info.instruction: Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water. To reduce risk during outdoor work the occupational safety and health administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 911.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Choctaw; Creek; Delaware; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Pushmataha
